subject: NFL
event:
Well, the NFL season got off to a rocky start for me with today's Jets - Patriots game.

Poor Chad.  I really feel for the guy.

Another victory for Evil Little Bill, I fear.  The Patriots offensive line played an awesome game.  The Jets pass rush never got close enough to Tom Brady to muss his hair.

And Thomas Jones, the Jets' big off-season acquisition, showed nothing.  I hope this is not an omen of things to come.  If so, it could be a long season.  Chad is most effective when he's faking handoffs in play-action, and you can't play-action without a running attack.

comments.article: Browns were just as horrible. Though I feel less was expected from them. You've got my sympathy.

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: bunny
comments.article: Looks like I missed all the drama -- last part of the game I caught, in the second quarter, NE went up 14-7. I would have liked to have seen that 108-yard kick-off return. Another grim year for NY.

took the day off to see jets suck again. bears d is murder but is chargers defence good or bears offence really sucks.
hope giants don't crap out on me tonight
comments.subject: nfl

comments.article: Oh me of little faith - I had Tony Gonzalez starting on my Fantasy team instead of Laveranues Coles. And I paid for it.

comments.upictitle: My love for you is like a truck, BERZERKER!: Space Boots
comments.article: At least you're not a Bills fan.  Brutal ending to that game.

comments.upictitle: Chris: Rene Magritte - Son of Man
comments.article: I'm a Pats fan, and that tackle made *me* cringe. I couldn't believe he was back in a few downs later...

I'm a JETS fan. It might be interesting to note that for a long time now, they're alternating good season-bad season. I think you can go as far back as my sophomore year of high school, and I'm a uni senior now.

Last year was a good year.

Thus, if we get more than five wins this year, I'll be really happy.

If the Jets get five wins or fewer this year, the New York media is going to turn on Mangini with a vengeance. The tabloids love nothing better than to build a guy up so they can tear him down later. One of the brutal realties about playing in New York City.

The Jets did overachieve last year... but they had underachieved the year before, in Herm's last season, and expectations were low. This will be a rougher year, a truer test.
comments.subject: five wins?

comments.article:
Sorry, but, Go Pats!

I'm a Redskins fan in Virginia. I got so angry at 1pm because for some reason we were seeing the Pats/Jets game instead of the local skins/dolphins game (both on CBS). I mean, the Pats are my AFC team, but I definitely prefer to watch my skins. I think a lot of people were angry about it and called the cable company, because by the end of the first quarter they'd fixed it so we were watching the right game.

I'm in Syracuse. In NY STATE. What did they show?

Bills/Broncos.


Ah, well, at least I got to watch my Yankees without feeling guilty!

LOL

GO PATRIOTS!!

?? :D
No.

Don't despair ... they are better than they looked today. Jones is injured and just coming back but he is solid and the line is solid. Chad isn't solid, but I think your backup is better anyway.

Unfortunately, I think your buddy bill has created a juggernaut up there. It wasn't that the Jets are bad; the Pats really are that good.

I'm a Skin's fan, so if you want to hear some tales of woe .....
comments.subject: Hi George

comments.article: I think that the Jets will do better than predicted if they use this game of a shining example of what they really need to do to shore up their ability to give their quarterback enough time to do what he needs to do.

comments.upictitle: Random Writings: Enter At Own Risk
comments.article:
The Jets were just overmatched today on both sides of the ball. I don't think that this one game is an indication of how their season will go, though. They won't challenge the Pats for the division, but they should be in the hunt for a wild card.

In four months let's see if I'm right. ;-)
Vikes did well today, I am pleased.  BTW, my god, Brett Farve looks horrible - did he play as bad as he looked?

The Packers offense was ... quite bad yesterday. Brett missed several open receivers on makeable throws, some of them quite short-range. Between the Eagles pass-rush and no running game, well... the Packers had to be handed the victory.

Not that I'm sorry they won, mind you. :-)
The Bucs got off to a good start, but then it all fell apart. :( At least Green Bay played a good game, despite that scary beginning!
Glad I drafted Leon Washington in my Fantasy Football draft. Another performance like that and Jones will be riding the pine.
Go Pats!!! =D

comments.upictitle: Mr. Cryptic Poster: Good Ol' Steve
comments.article:
Read "The Education of a Coach" and you may not be so quick to condemn Bill. Then again, its worth reading for Halberstam's excellent writing.

I will say I was shocked at the overly-warm reception Jets fans gave the backup QB. I was not aware Pennington was so disliked.

comments.upictitle: Xray Is As Xray Does: bunny
comments.article: Currently waiting for the Giants game to start; suffering through some Talking Heads. whoops, now they're playing that damned kick-off return again. Pah.

I am a Vikings fan, so I know the pain of being a steadfast fan. Hang in there.

I have one small grumble...please do not refer to yourself as "the American Tolkien." He is beyond compare to anyone.

I am a fan, and I look forward to the next book, however long it takes. I appreciate your doing the right thing by us and skipping those events to get work done.
comments.subject: Sorry about the Jets

comments.article:
Well, at least the Giants started off fairly well -- big TD strike on their first possession.

(And then they botched the snap... and now the $@#&^ Cowboys are driving... and so it goes.)

Yeah the Pats are just outright diabiolical - from the evilness of Bill B to Tom Brady's nefarious robotic talents and his weapons of mass annihilation, which are thanks to those two so much. They're going to be hard to beat as usual, if not harder than usual...


But the real game is happening right now between the hated Giants and America's team...yeah, that's right, the Cowboys and I got that 'hated' giants from you George - thanks man ;) May the best team (the Dallas Cowboys) win!

Out of bounds Armani!!!!

Go Seahawks!

We didn't see the Jets-Pats game, but did manage to catch the Seahawks beating the Bucs, which was sweet, and Oakland losing to the Tigers, also sweet. (We hate the Traitors for ever leaving Oakland.)

Bills fan myself.
Was so lame to watch 59 minutes and 59 seconds of a game, happy, only to have all happiness shattered in the final second.
My thoughts and prayers are with Kevin Everett.
GO PATS!
My Bears lost too, but at least they looked pretty good against the Chargers.  There were just too many turnovers.  I'm again very excited for this season. :)
